title: larry_vw_1955
author: larry_vw_1955
content: The stablecoin USDC has nearly regained parity with the U.S. dollar after rising just above $0.99 on March 12, 2023, at 7:20 p.m. Eastern Time. The stablecoin jumped back to the $0.99 range after the U.S. Federal Reserve revealed it would bail out depositors of California’s Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) and New York’s Signature Bank. Following the Fed announcement, Circle CEO Jeremy Allaire said on Twitter that the company would rely on BNY Mellon to settle the process of minting and redemption.quoted from:https://news.bitcoin.com/usdc-stablecoin-nears-parity-with-usd-after-feds-bailout-announcement/

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: From what I understand, they technically didn’t get “bailed out” because Circle requested a wire on Thursday which was before the cut off time which was Friday morning. They were going to get the full amount anyways even if the deposits weren’t covered 100%.Keep in mind they didn’t bail out the bank or shareholders. The bank is gone and if trading ever resumes it will trade close to $0 pretty much.
